title: Share a tip about your favorite champion everyone should know
body:
There's a lot to learn to know everything about every champion in League. 

Let's help get new summoners started by sharing a tip or two about your favorite champion (or one of your favorites, if you have a hard time making up your mind like I do) that everyone should know. 

It can be a tip for playing as or against them. 

{{champion:68}} - When Rumble overheats he gets bonus magic damage on all of his attacks, but this bonus damage doesn't apply to turrets.

replies.body: {{champion:59}}  You can press R to make the walls of your ult collapse (useful when you're chasing/under turrets)

Also useful for when you're "helping".

http://i.imgur.com/dPNCspU.png
{{champion:27}} Unless you absolutely know you can kill Singed without a problem, don't chase him.
Perhaps one of the first lessons I learned in League...

{{champion:45}} Most people focus on Veigar's 100-0 wtfburst potential. Pros rarely discuss Veigar, but when they do, they talk more about his stun than his ult. This is wisdom.

{{champion:45}} Veigar gains +1 AP (value ~22g) from last-hitting a small minion or monster with Q. This approximately doubles the value of a lane minion. For dinky monsters like wraiths (i.e. chickens), this means that Veigar gains about 26g total from them, while other Champions gain only about 4g. Be nice to Veigar.

{{champion:45}} Lore bonus: Veigar is an adorable fuzzball who was locked away in solitary by Noxians. He was deprived of snuggles until he snapped and became a dark mage. This may be the best Champion backstory in League of Legends.
{{champion:45}}  Veigar's stun (aka "The Cage", "The Rage Cage", "E") is essentially a second ultimate in my books if we're being honest here.

> {{champion:45}}  Veigar's stun (aka "The Cage", "The Rage Cage", "E") is essentially a second ultimate in my books if we're being honest here.

Yes.

{{champion:45}} The first trick everyone learns with Veigar is the EWQR/DFG mega-burst combination. It's a good trick. However, in a teamfight situation, it's often best to try to stun two or more enemy Champions for your team, and rely on just your RQ+DFG to burst a high-value target.

But I'd add that it's an ult you can miss:

{{champion:45}} Veigar's stun is best understood as a ring-shaped skillshot. (If it were a filled circle, it would be broken-OP.) You can miss Veigar's stun: if you don't land the curved edge directly on top of the target(s), you have missed, and are probably about to get obliterated.

Hah, I hope that comment didn't get taken negatively - I just want to impress on folks how awesome it is. 

Missing the ring and {{item:3102}} Banshee's Veil are certainly large weaknesses for the Cage. As you've mentioned, if you miss it...

{{champion:86}} - You should stop Garen's spin early if you are no longer dealing damage with it.  Stopping it early puts it on cooldown, meaning it will be off cooldown sooner than if you spun for the full duration.
Tip for playing *with* {{champion:201}} - His passive is a stun. If you see part of a ram's head on an enemy champ that Braum is trying to AA, f\*\*\*ing focus it.
Hello fellow Braumer, thus we suffer in silence no more

{{champion:55}} Katarina gains 15% damage reduction for 1.5 seconds when she uses her Shunpo. You can take advantage of this against global ultimates like {{champion:30}}. If you have good reflexes, you can also reduce the damage taken by a direct nuke, DoT or any projectile.
Katarina can also shunpo to any target aside from turrets. She can even jump to J4's banner, but **only if he is an ally**.

Lastly: Katarina's ultimate will light up if there is an enemy in range (and you've learned the skill) even if you cannot see them. You can use this as an early warning system when face-checking brushes or if a stealthed enemy is near you. ({{champion:121}} {{champion:29}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:17}} )

When playing {{champion:412}}, taking Flay first gives you some really nasty autoattack damage early on. You can do significant damage along with your ADC to anybody unfortunate enough to walk too close. Harass harass harass!

{{champion:51}}  Her traps are among the best skills in the game. Drop one whenever an enemy uses Zhonya's, GA,  Zil ult... Drop one whenever an enemy gets stunned, rooted, snared or charmed to extend the CC duration. Drop one on your allied blitz, or right behind your singed, volibear etc. Drop one anytime the enemy TF ults in, or when the top laner TPs for a surprise gank but OOOPS! YOU STUCK ON A CUPCAKE BROTHA! Drop them everywhere!!!
Drop one into a bush for vision. Drop them at the edges of bushes for complete bush control. Drop several in key locations to force the enemies into a specific attack path. 

 About her R. In most situations, it should be used anytime you have a clear shot at a squishy. This is less true when they have a lot of sustain or heal, but only slightly less true.

{{champion:238}} When playing Zed, look for a spinning shrunken above a Death Marked enemies head, meaning your death mark will kill  the enemy.

Ebb and Flow scales quadraticaly with AP. Normaly, for each bounce the heal/damage weakens by 15%, but this weakening effect is lowered with AP. When she hits 200 AP, she no longer loses value with the bounces, and she will actually start to gain more value, appart from the normal AP ratio (0.5 damage & 0.35 heal). It effectivly gains a double scaling for the second bouce and a triple for the third one. 
Tidecaller's Blessing  damage is based on **her target** Magic penetracion, and Nami own AP.
Tidal Wave immediatly triggers Nami's passive on herself no matter what direccions she throws it. Allies that come in contact with it afterwards also gain it
{{champion:43}} time
Inner fire dies off if it does not hit a target, but Soulflare always blows up. Soulflare has a larger AoE than Inner Fire, as both the inicial and delayed parts of damage deal it at a bigger area. Combining those 2 facts, you get that Soulflare has longer range than Inner Fire (roughtly +125) and can be used to snipe
Both focused resolve and Renewal deal damage a total of 3 times (0.66 delay between each tick). This means it triggers her passive *three times*, lowering Mantra's cd by a whooping 6 seconds. If you are planning a snare-Soulflare combo feel free to go once Mantra cd is at 6
Renewals heals Karma once at the start and once the snare yes, but if her target dies before the snare trigers she gets the heal anyways.  
Defiance haste, damage & shield AoE is about 75-100 units bigger than the indicator actually shows
Because it does nothing on its own, Mantra can be cast while under any form of CC, even silence and supression

Sanguine pool cd starts at the moment Vlad casts it, not when it ends. At max rank with 40% cdr ( not actually dat hard on Vlad if you go Ionian boots) and combined with Zhonya's active it only has a downtime of 3.5 seconds. You can also cast summoner spells while pooled, such as flash or ignite
the most important tip I can give is if u click on thresh's lanterns {{champion:412}}  after he throws it u will travel to him
Nami has a passive. Most people don't seem to realize this.

The passive even applies to allies when you aren't specifically targeting them. 

For example hitting an ally with your bubble will give them the speed boost. (Even though this seems unlikely to be the best way to use your bubble...)

More usefully, catching your team in your ultimate will speed everyone up as well!
Nautis Shield (W) also resets his AutoAttack (cause that is what shields do *cough*), always make sure you get one hit through before you activate it to make optimal use of it.

Wow, I didn't know that. With a super slow autoattack like {{champion:111}} Nautilus' this tip is even more useful. 

For those unfamiliar with the concept auto attack resets, this means that if you attack just before pressing W you will be able to autoattack again a bit faster than you normally could because you don't have to wait for the first attack to complete its animation before starting the next one. By mastering this you can do more damage than normal in the same amount of time. 

This thread from the old boards goes into more detail about what exactly this can mean for you if you'd like further reading: http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1741567

{{champion:35}}  Shaco - Using R:Hallucinate doesn't break stealth.  Try stealthing into a group and using you're ult before attacking.  With luck, you're foes will drop their cooldowns on the clone before you come out of stealth, greatly reducing their combat effectiveness in the fight.  Don't worry about losing the crit from your Q either as there is a small window after your stealth drops for your attack to crit.

{{champion:99}} Lux's ultimate procs her passive and applies a new instance, so be extra wary of it in addition to her autoattacks when you have her passive on you.

Correction: Yasuo's ultimate gives him 50% armor penetration for free against **bonus armor such as the armor given from items, runes and masteries. It does not apply to base armor.**

{{champion:143}} Zyra's Stranglethorns increases the attack speed of her plants located inside the ability by 50%. This increase in damage is VERY significant and should not be underestimated. Zyra's plants should be avoided or taken out safely, it's not worth taking hits from her plants when she is relatively safe.


{{champion:161}} Once reaching level 6 Vel'koz has a 500 base damage ult that procs his pasive at least once, most likely twice if combined with at least one other spell. Vel'koz CAN and WILL 100-0 most champions at level 6 if you let him. Play very careful and save cc for when he ults. It's better to interrupt him than to just turn and run. If you have no other choice but to run, don't run in a straight vertical line, run to the side as fast as you can.

Contrary to popular belief, regardless of the fact that {{champion:102}} builds primarily AD, the vast majority of her damage is actually magic. This is because Burnout (W) is her single largest source of damage, and her E adds a fair bit of magic damage to each auto-attack as well. This means that building armor is actually not especially helpful when trying to defend against her, but it also means that magic pen/MR shred is deceptively powerful on her.  Never underestimate the strength of {{item:3091}} in her claws.

>  Never underestimate the strength of {{item:3091}} in her claws.

And Wit's End's attack speed also synergies well with her overall game plan of punchin' dudes to stay dragonized.
Champions that wear glasses take exactly one less damage from {{champion:89}} ult.

{{champion:120}} When Hecarim smite monsters, minions or pets during his W he heals himself due to its healing nature.

{{champion:120}} When Hecarim starts to use his amplified auto-attack with his E (when you jump on the enemy) nothing can stop him. With it he can travel through snares, stuns and so on. However the CC is still applied.

{{champion:105}} Jungle Fizz can use Playful over wall->Smite->Trickster back over everything that let him pass in the first place. This is very useful for Dragon/Baron steals.

{{champion:14}} {{item:3022}} Frozen Mallet is an almost must-have item on the new Sion. The slow works with his innate. This results in an unstoppable killing machine with a slow on his fists.

{{champion:31}}   Most people talk about how hard it is to harass with Q, this is a major mistake to make in lane.
Your main form of harass, CS and general screw you to your lane opponent needs to be your vorpal spikes.  The range can help you harass most opponents simply by positioning when you go to nab a CS.

Another good tip is never to let your feast go to waste.  If you don't think you can execute an opponent in the next minute, don't bother holding onto it, just eat a minion for the stack and health.  It's also a very good tool for forcing carries out of fights.  Landing your feast can scare them and force them to burn their escape and place themselves out of range to properly help their team.

{{champion:34}}'s Q can break spell shields and banshee's veil and still stun people if you let the projectile pass through someone and then reactivate it once it it behind them. It also deals double damage this way. It deals damage for hitting someone and then again for when it explodes.

{{champion:222}} Pow-Pow > Fishbones for DPS.

This is a huge misconception that people have when playing Jinx. The AS boost of Pow-Pow makes anything past your first attack has more total DPS over Fishbones.
Fishbones, as a rule of thumb, should only be used when out of range for Pow-Pow or when you need the AoE more than you do killing a single target.
The slower AA animation of Fishbones also makes kiting harder than using Pow-Pow, especially with how it lacks an AS steroid.
When {{champion:41}} ults with a phage/triforce, you still get the movement speed proc just from your cannonballs. Really helps {{champion:41}}  follow up on an engage in a fight.

With {{champion:3}} you should wait till your W is active before casting your abilities since the increase in MR it gives you also boosts your ap because his passive.

With {{champion:120}} practice the timing of his q and e dash since if timed right the movement speed increase of his e can allow one of his Qs to do almost double damage. When both are combined it ends up being a surprisingly high amount of burst
For {{champion:69}} don't use your mouse to activate ability.

If done right then {{champion:154}}  Zac can actually jump into the purple team's base on The Crystal Scar map via his E, Elastic Slingshot, and not get damaged by the turrets either as well while doing so. This does require that Zac have at least three (3) points into his E ability first though since by then he will have enough range to actually just jump into the purple team's base from the outside wall and actually stay there without getting damaged by the turrets there either as well.

Of course there are some other champions that can do it too such as {{champion:127}}  Lissandra for example there but {{champion:154}} Zac is definitely and by far the easiest one to do it with there out of all of the champions that are in the game right now currently as well though, so there's that at least.

P.S. And before you ask, yes, this does only work with the purple team's base and not the blue team's base so keep that in mind when trying to do this trick as him on there as well please, so there's that at least.

Zac can jump from dragon/baron pit right into the red camp on either side. Great for counter jungling when they have their entrances warded; go straight to red avoiding all the entrances.

EDIT: useful in reverse as well--often when doing baron or dragon, the enemy team will ward up the jungle on the other side. But if you walk into the red area as far as you can, you can jump right into baron/dragon pit and surprise smite it out from under them. Best if you have flash up so you can get right out over the wall again.
Leona has a auto attack rest on her q and can kill a stealth ward lvl 1 solo

{{champion:28}} Her W does a lot more than you think. In addition to the speed boost, it cleanses slows on activation, passively gives you movespeed whenever you attack an enemy, and resets on kills or assists. Rather than W right off the bat when ganking, wait for the enemy to slow you for maximum efficiency. In teamfights and skirmishes, prioritize the lowest health targets to get as many Ws off as you can - you'll be motoring around like full AP Lulu after a kill or two.
